title._content: Christmas card issued by Greenfield and Barraclough, Brisbane Opticians, ca. 1893

description._content: Creator: Poulsen, P. C. Description: Promotional Christmas card sent to clients. Greenfield and Barraclough,the opticians operated out of George Street, Brisbane. The front of the card features a sketch of human eye and photographs of Queensland legislators and ministers. On the reverse of the card it reads: 'Messrs Greenfield & Barraclough present their compliments to their many Patrons, and hope for a continuance of past favors. We wish to specially impress on the minds of all customers that we have a complete record of all past examinations, from which orders can be made up at any time. Intending country clients write us for particulars of our Self-Testing method before giving orders for spectacles locally. Our speciality is Sight Testing and Scientific Spectacle Adjusting.' (Description supplied with photograph.) View this page at the State Library of Queensland: hdl.handle.net/10462/deriv/135569 Information about State Library of Queensland’s collection: www.slq.qld.gov.au/resources/picture-queensland
